title: James Nasmyth, Engineer: An Autobiography
author: Nasmyth, James
snippet: See Burkes's Peerage and Baronetage* [footnote...In Burke's Peerage and Baronetage an account is given of the Foulisfamily.  They are of Norman origin.  A branch settled in Scotland inthe reign of Malcolm Canmore.  By various intermarriages, the Foulisesare connected with the Hopetoun, Bute, and Rosebery families.The present holder of the title represents the houses of Colinton,Woodhall, and Ravelstone. ...]

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: On the south shore, at the mouth of the River Almond, stand the village of Cramontl, and Cramoiid House, (Lady Torphichen), and a little further west is Dalmeny Parle, the seat of tlie P:arl of Rosebery.

title: Old diaries, 1881-1901 /
author: Gower, Ronald Sutherland
snippet: I am glad Rosebery(whose first visit this is to Dunrobin) should see it in brilliantweather.

title: Old diaries, 1881-1901 /
author: Gower, Ronald Sutherland
snippet: One day we called on Angeli, the Courtportrait-painter ; he had begun a portrait of Everard forhis brother, Rosebery.
